fi.grimripper.loww

Enum Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Direction>
      • fi.grimripper.loww.Direction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Direction>

    public enum Direction
extends java.lang.Enum<Direction>
    Depicts the eight compass directions, and contains some operations for utilizing them with hexes and squares.
    Author:
    Marko Tuominen
    See Also:
    Hex, Square

      • getClosest

        public Direction getClosest(Direction[] sel)
        Takes a selection of directions and picks the one closest to this one. If two of the directions are equal, it is unspecified which is picked.
        Parameters:
        sel - selection of directions to pick from (not null and not an empty array, and no nulls in the array)
        Returns:
        the closest direction in the selection

      • getAdjacentCW

        public Direction getAdjacentCW()
        Gets the adjacent direction clockwise.
        Returns:
        clockwise adjacent direction

      • getAdjacentCCW

        public Direction getAdjacentCCW()
        Gets the adjacent direction counter-clockwise.
        Returns:
        counter-clockwise adjacent direction

      • getAdjacentTowards

        public Direction getAdjacentTowards(Direction to)
        Returns adjacent direction closer to another direction. If the parameter is same as this direction, next direction clockwise is returned. Similarly, if the parameter is the opposite direction, next direction counter-clockwise is returned.
        Parameters:
        to - get adjacent direction closer to this direction
        Returns:
        adjacent direction that is closer to given direction than this one

      • isDueEast

        public boolean isDueEast()
        Checks if this direction is generally towards east. Includes northeast, east and southeast.
        Returns:
        true if this direction is towards east

      • isDueNorth

        public boolean isDueNorth()
        Checks if this direction is generally towards north. Includes northwest, north and northeast.
        Returns:
        true if the direction is towards north

      • isDueSouth

        public boolean isDueSouth()
        Checks if this direction is generally towards south. Includes southeast, south and southwest.
        Returns:
        true if the direction is towards south

      • isDueWest

        public boolean isDueWest()
        Checks if this direction is generally towards west. Includes northwest, west and southwest.
        Returns:
        true if the direction is towards west

      • isHorizontal

        public boolean isHorizontal()
        Checks if this direction is along the horizontal axis of a compass. Includes west and east.
        Returns:
        true if the direction is horizontal in compass

      • isVertical

        public boolean isVertical()
        Checks if this direction is along the vertical axis of a compass. Includes north and south.
        Returns:
        true if the direction is vertical in compass
